children.subject:
Just some suggestions if you don't find some paid work: you could try to seek out some open-source project to work on, there may even be some related to COVID-19! You could take a summer class (or audit one if you just want the knowledge), you can begin your own project(s) and just take the summer to really beef them up for a good resume piece! Since you may be able to work from home and not have to pay for housing elsewhere, it could be the chance to do an unpaid internship and not let that be too much of a financial hit (and I'm sure companies would be more willing to do something remotely for an unpaid intern). 

There's a lot of people in your boat (possibly even me, I haven't gotten final word yet from my company but it's likely they will cancel :/ ). This site gives a pretty good idea of just what proportion of companies have cancelled too (and a few that are still hiring). Whatever you end up doing, try not to worry too much about all this though, lots of internships are getting cancelled. Good luck!

history.content: I recently lost my summer SWE internship due to COVID-19 and am currently struggling to find another plan for the summer. Does anyone have any know of any labs on campus still hiring for the summer, know of any startups/companies still hiring for the summer, or have any other suggestions for summer plans? Any help would be appreciated, thanks!
history.subject: Summer Plan Ideas
